trial_identification.studytitle: Occurrence of genitourinary infections and describing the epidemiological profile of pregnant teenagers at the Intituto de Saude Elpidio de Almeida - ISEA in Campina Grande, Paraiba, Brazil
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Occurrence of genitourinary infections and describing the epidemiological profile of pregnant teenagers at the Intituto de Saude Elpidio de Almeida - ISEA in Campina Grande, Paraiba, Brazil
trial_identification.secondaryid: Comite de Etica of the Universidade Estadual da Paraiba, number:0367.0.133.000-08.

conditions.healthcondition: This study addresses the presence of urinary or vaginal infections in pregnant women in Brazilian public institution.
Epidemioly of public health in Campina Grande in Paraiba.

interventions.interventions: 92 participants underwent laboratory testing, providing a urine sample to perform urine and vaginal secretion sample to vaginal culture once only. The test results were delivered to participants after 15 days of its completion and were instructed to show them to your doctor about prenatal care.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The epidemiological profile tracing shows that the participants meet the quality of life compromised, more than half haven't finished elementary school and dropped out of school, living with family income than minimum wage, they had their first sexual intercourse with up to 14 years old and they are primiparous.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At the baseline intervention commencement in 2009.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Pregnant women attended in the public hospital of Campina Grande, Paraiba, Brazil.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Pregnant women attended in the public hospital of Campina Grande who did not accept to participate in research, with gestational age less than 16 weeks or minors without permission from the controller.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Universidade Estadual da Paraiba R. Baraunas, 351 - Bairro Universitario, - Campina Grande-PB-Brazil, CEP 58429-500

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Universidade Estadual da Paraiba R. Baraunas, 351 - Bairro Universitario, - Campina Grande-PB-Brazil, CEP 58429-500,

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Av. Mal Floriano Peixoto, 776 Centro, Campina Grande - PB - Brazil CEP: 58.100-000

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this study is to evaluate the occurrence of genitourinary tract infections among pregnant women in Campina Grande and the surrounding region. We hypothesized that Brazilian women, pregnant women with low education and income poor have higher rates of genitourinary infections than the average nationally and globally.
